definition: to hold (expectations, hopes etc)/to maintain (an attitude etc)/to harbor (doubts etc)/to clinch (boxing)
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: All you can do is hope for the best.
sentences.chinese: 你所能做的就是抱持乐观的陶都。

sentences.english: Many European immigrants hold the ideals of the American Dream to the United States.
sentences.chinese: 许多欧洲移民都是抱持著美国梦的理想前往美国的。

sentences.english: Many European immigrants hold the American dream of the ideal of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 许多欧洲移民都是抱持著美国梦的理想前往美国的。

sentences.english: Grief makes us so much more tender to other people's suffering.
sentences.chinese: 悲伤让我们对于别人的遭遇会更抱持着温柔的态度。

definition: to look favorably on sth/would be glad to see it happen
variant of 意識形態|意识形态[yi4 shi2 xing2 tai4]
to adopt or carry out (measures, policies, course of action)/to take
to rely on/to be dependent on
because of/on the basis of/in view of/on account of
